page.title: 02TAWSTOCK COURT
page.content: {TAWSTOCK COURT. { Tawstock Court:Grid reference 29/55, is two hundred years old and replaced an earlier mansion,once the seat of the Earls of Bath was accidentaly destroyed by fire.Small portions of the Elizabethan house survive, including the imposing Gatehouse with its castellations and armorial embellishments; further parts were added in the nineteenth century. A full description of the building and its history appears in the May edition of "Devon and West". The old Tawstock Court was the family seat of the Bouchiers.In the eleventh century Tawstock Manor was held by King William according to the original{ {DOMESDAY BOOK. }
